you, sir, are the god of handheld uploads. i havent found a bad one yet lol. i registered to say thanks for all you

I can't speak for newer PSPs, as I only have an older one, but I can say that some m4v files just can't be read by it. It's very unfortunate, and it seems random-- some videos I have made MYSELF work, while others I've used the same program on just don't, for no discernible reason.

Regardless, there's no reason to squeal and rage just because something doesn't work for you. Sometimes a download is bad, sometimes there's a problem with your player, and sometimes there's just random, unexplainable issues. Either way, unless something is a genuinely shitty copy OR carries a virus, there's no reason to get all up in arms over it.

P.S. Again, can't speak for new PSPs, but old-school ones simply don't read .srt files. Subtitles aren't an option.
i agree holyroses is the one and only and safest i might and four years of downloading never one prob,thanks very much!
